title: Establishing and Implementing the President's "Department of Government Efficiency"

enrichment.summary: This executive order creates the Department of Government Efficiency to modernize federal technology and software, improving government operations and productivity. It restructures the U.S. Digital Service into the U.S. DOGE Service, establishes specialized teams in agencies to support this effort, and ensures agencies provide access to their systems for modernization work.
potential_concerns: The requirement for agencies to provide USDS full access to their IT systems may raise data privacy and security concerns, potentially affecting working-age adults who rely on government digital services.
The accelerated 18-month timeline for modernization could lead to rushed implementations, causing disruptions or decreased service quality impacting the broader working-age adult population.
Technology workers may face increased pressure to rapidly adapt to new interagency coordination protocols and systems integration, potentially straining workforce capacity and morale.
Interoperability mandates may unintentionally create vulnerabilities if legacy systems are integrated without thorough security vetting, risking sensitive government and citizen data.
